column5: A first hand look at what netting can cost a lake and a community.. are we next?  Please guys lets keep this civil  http://www.myfoxtwincities.com/myfox/pages...mp;pageId=1.1.1  http://www.myfoxtwincities.com/myfox/pages...mp;pageId=1.1.1  G

A treaty is a treaty, so there really isn't anything people can do about that.  However, I think they should only be allowed to net AFTER the spawn..  Taking those females stuffed full of eggs before the spawn has a bigger dent on the fish population then just the removal of 122,500lbs of fish.  Anyone wanna guess who will be the first to complain when there are no more walleyes to gill net in Mille Lacs?
This is posted every year at least once and it has never done anything positive for our community. It generates bad feelings. What is offensive to some people is a living to others.
